Submodules¶

scatterbytes.chunk module¶

class scatterbytes.chunk.Chunk(file_path)[source]¶

Bases: object

chunk of a file

Data always has crc32 checksum appended.

file_path
full filesystem path to the chunk
file_name
local name for the chunk
size
size of the chunk on the filesystem
calc_hash(salt=None, return_type='base64')[source]¶

calculate the hash for the chunk

chunk_size[source]¶

“size of the chunk, which must be at least CHUNK_SIZE_MIN

crc32_checksum[source]¶
file_name[source]¶
read(raw=False, byte_range=None)[source]¶

read data excluding the checksum

size[source]¶

size including checksum if present

verify_checksum()[source]¶

perform a crc32 checksum

verify_hash(hash)[source]¶
scatterbytes.chunk.checksum_chunk(file_path)[source]¶

checksum file using the stored crc32 value

Last 4 bytes is a crc32 checksum.

Parameters:file_path (str) – path to file to be checked
Raises ChunkChecksumError:
 if checksum fails
Return type:None
scatterbytes.chunk.read_crc32_checksum(f)[source]¶

Read the crc32 checksum appended to the data.

Returns the crc32 checksum as an integer.

Parameters:f – file object or path
Return type:int

scatterbytes.crypt module¶

cryptography and hashing

class scatterbytes.crypt.AESKey(binary_key, binary_salt=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

AES key

Provides convenience in dealing with AES keys. Aids in creating a key using password stretching and in base64 conversion of binary data.

classmethod create_pbkdf2(passphrase, salt='', iterations=10000, keylen=16)[source]¶

Create an encryption key for AES using pbkdf2

Params:
passphrase (bytes): passphrase to stretch into a key
Kwargs:

salt (bytes): data to salt the passphrase iterations (int): iterations for pbkdf2 function keylen (int): output key length in bytes

Default to 128 bit per Schneier: https://www.schneier.com/blog/archives/2009/07/another_new_aes.html

Returns AESKey

class scatterbytes.crypt.CRL(crl_path)[source]¶

Bases: object

wrapper for M2Crypto.X509.CRL

adds ability to read details and check signature

verify(sig, cert)[source]¶

verify CRL with pkey

sig
external signature to work around M2Crypto not verifying CRL sig
cert
M2Crypto.X509.X509 instance - typically the root CA cert

scatterbytes.crypt.calc_file_crc32(f, contains_checksum=False)[source]¶

calculate the crc32 checksum for a file

Args:
f (file): file to calculate crc32 for
Kwargs:
contains_checksum (bool): f contains checksum in last 4 bytes.
Returns:
checksum as a signed integer
scatterbytes.crypt.calc_file_hash(f, salt=None, constructor=<built-in function openssl_sha1>, return_type='base64')[source]¶

Calculate a hash for a file.

Params:
f (file): file-like object of path to a file
Kwargs:

salt (bytes): data used to salt the hash constructor (func): function to create the hash return_type (str): format for returned hash value.

should be one of base64, base32, hex, or int
Returns:
hash encoded as return_type
scatterbytes.crypt.calc_hash(data, salt=None, constructor=<built-in function openssl_sha1>)[source]¶

calculate the hash for data

Params:
data (bytes): data to be hashed
Kwargs:
salt (bytes): data used to salt the hash constructor (func): function to create the hash
Returns:
base64 encoded hash
scatterbytes.crypt.create_certificate(csr, serial_number, days_valid, ca_pkey, ca_cert=None, is_ca=False, output_path=None)[source]¶

Create a new X509 Certificate

For a self signed cert, ca_cert is None.

The cert chain will only be added when output_path is specified.

scatterbytes.crypt.create_csr(pkey, CN, O='ScatterBytes Network', output_path=None)[source]¶

Create and return a M2Crypto.X509.Request

scatterbytes.crypt.create_pkey(key_size=2048, output_path=None)[source]¶

Create RSA key pair.

key_size of 2048 recquired by NIST

scatterbytes.crypt.load_certificate(cert_path=None, wrap=False)[source]¶

load a public key - with private key if available

scatterbytes.crypt.stretch_passphrase(passphrase, salt=None, iterations=10000, length=16, output_format='binary')[source]¶

Stretch a passphrase using pbkdf2

Params:
passphrase (str): Passphrase to be stretched.
Kwargs:
salt (bytes): data to salt with iterations (int): iterations to use in pbkdf2 length (int): length in bytes of stretched passphrase output_format (str): return format of binary or base64 encoding
Returns:
stretched passphrase encoded as binary or base64

certificate[source]¶

check_certificate()[source]¶

Check our certificate and get a new one if needed.

check_certificate_expired()[source]¶
get_certificate(owner_name)[source]¶
load_certificates(retries=3, wait_time=10)[source]¶

Get all server certificates from the control node.

This includes:
  • software signer certificate
  • relay command signer certificate
  • root CA’s CRL
  • signature for CRL (hack) - M2Crypto can’t verify CRL
retries
number of times to retry for failed attempts
wait_time
seconds to wait between attempts
make_ssl_context()[source]¶

generate an ssl context for this node

node_O = 'ScatterBytes Network'¶
node_id[source]¶
reload_ssl_context()[source]¶

reload ssl context for control node if cert has changed

request_new_certificate()[source]¶

Obtain an X509 certificate from the control node.

If a valid certificate code is set in configuration, as is done during service initialization, a certificate is obtained from the control node.

show_account()[source]¶
scatterbytes.node.download_certificates(control_node_proxy, ssl_dir, retries=0, wait_time=0)[source]¶

Get all server certificates from the control node.

This includes:
  • software signer certificate
  • relay command signer certificate
  • root CA’s CRL
  • signature for CRL (hack) - M2Crypto can’t verify CRL
retries
number of times to retry for failed attempts
wait_time
seconds to wait between attempts

scatterbytes.validation module¶

class scatterbytes.validation.BTCAddressField(*args, **kw)[source]¶

Bases: formencode.api.FancyValidator

Messages

badType:
The input must be a string (not a %(type)s: %(value)r)
empty:
Please enter a value
invalid:

class scatterbytes.validation.BTCPaymentThreshold(*args, **kw)[source]¶

Bases: formencode.validators.Int

validate satoshi threshold for which payments are made to a storage node

It is expressed in satoshi (10^-8 BTC) as an integer.

Messages

badType:
The input must be a string (not a %(type)s: %(value)r)
empty:
Please enter a value
integer:
Please enter an integer value
noneType:
The input must be a string (not None)
tooHigh:
Please enter a number that is %(max)s or smaller
tooLow:
Please enter a number that is %(min)s or greater
declarative_count = 54¶

min = 100000¶
